genelist_analysis.py -analyse gene lists (GO, etc.)¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

Todo

describe purpose of the script.

Usage¶

Example:

python cgat_script_template.py --help

Type:

python cgat_script_template.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: genelist_analysis.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -s SPECIES, --species=SPECIES
                        species to use [default=none].
  -i FILENAME_SLIMS, --slims=FILENAME_SLIMS
                        filename with GO SLIM categories [default=none].
  -g FILENAME_GENES, --genes=FILENAME_GENES
                        filename with genes to analyse [default=-].
  -f FILENAME_FORMAT, --format=FILENAME_FORMAT
                        filename format [default=list].
  -b FILENAME_BACKGROUND, --background=FILENAME_BACKGROUND
                        filename with background genes to analyse
                        [default=none].
  -o SORT_ORDER, --sort-order=SORT_ORDER
                        output sort order [default=ratio].
  --ontology=ONTOLOGY   go ontologies to analyze. Ontologies are tested
                        separately. [default=[]].
  -t THRESHOLD, --threshold=THRESHOLD
                        significance threshold [>1.0 = all ]. If --fdr is set,
                        this refers to the fdr, otherwise it is a cutoff for
                        p-values.
  --filename-dump=FILENAME_DUMP
                        dump GO category assignments into a flatfile
                        [default=none].
  --filename-ontology=FILENAME_ONTOLOGY
                        filename with ontology in OBO format [default=none].
  --filename-assignments=FILENAME_ASSIGNMENTS
                        read ontology assignments from a flatfile
                        [default=none].
  --sample=SAMPLE       do sampling (with # samples) [default=0].
  --filename-output-pattern=OUTPUT_FILENAME_PATTERN
                        pattern with output filename pattern (should contain:
                        %(go)s and %(section)s ) [default=none]
  --output-filename-pattern=OUTPUT_FILENAME_PATTERN
                        pattern with output filename pattern (should contain:
                        %(go)s and %(section)s ) [default=none]
  --fdr                 calculate and filter by FDR [default=False].
  --go2goslim           convert go assignments in STDIN to goslim assignments
                        and write to STDOUT [default=none].
  --gene-pattern=GENE_PATTERN
                        pattern to transform identifiers to GO gene names
                        [default=none].
  --filename-map-slims=FILENAME_MAP_SLIMS
                        write mapping between GO categories and GOSlims
                        [default=none].
  --get-genes=GET_GENES
                        list all genes in the with a certain GOID
                        [default=none].
  --strict              require all genes in foreground to be part of
                        background. If not set, genes in foreground will be
                        added to the background [default=False].
  -q QVALUE_METHOD, --qvalue-method=QVALUE_METHOD
                        method to perform multiple testing correction by
                        controlling the fdr [default=empirical].
  --qvalue-lambda=QVALUE_LAMBDA
                        fdr computation: set lambda to fixed value
                        [default=none].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
